## Study Area

`r study_area_description`

```{r, fig.width=10, fig.height=10, echo=FALSE}
# plot(study_area_geometry$geometry)
## Next load the Regional Districts data, then extract and plot the Kootenays

bc_bounds <- bc_bound(ask = FALSE)
nr_raw <- nr_regions(ask = FALSE)
nr <- nr_raw |> st_set_crs(st_crs(bc_bounds)) |> st_intersection(bc_bounds)

study_area_proj <- study_area_geometry |> st_transform(crs=st_crs(nr))

custom_blue <- "#1e8dba"

study_area_bc <- ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = nr,
          aes(fill = REGION_NAME, col = REGION_NAME, alpha = 0.4)) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(9, "Set3")) +
  scale_color_manual(values = RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(9, "Set3")) +
  geom_sf(data = study_area_geometry,
          col = custom_blue, fill = custom_blue, alpha = 0.6) +
  theme_void() +
  theme(legend.position = 'none')

study_area_bc
```

```{r, eval = T}
sa_bbox <- study_area_proj |> st_bbox()

study_area <- study_area_bc +
  coord_sf(xlim = c(sa_bbox[1], sa_bbox[3]),
           ylim =  c(sa_bbox[2], sa_bbox[4]))

study_area
```
